item.title: Prelim round of Chemistry Olympiad held at RU
item.description: As in previous years, the preliminary round of the 15th Bangladesh Chemistry Olympiad 2026 for students of the Rajshahi region was held at Rajshahi University (RU), organised under the initiative of the Bangladesh Chemical Society. The Department of Chemistry, University of Dhaka, and the Banglade

item.title: Hajj visa applications thru Nusak Masar to continue from Feb 8 until Mar 20
item.description: Bangladeshi intending Hajj 2026 pilgrims could submit their visa applications through Nusak Masar platform from February 8 until March 20 this year. Nusak Masar is the official Saudi platform for booking Hajj packages, mandatory for international pilgrims to obtain visas. Pilgrims must register,

item.title: Voters in Gaibandha char areas demand a tangible plan, not lip service, to fight erosion
item.description: GAIBANDHA, Jan 31: Voters in the char (shoal) areas of Gaibandha district are demanding a tangible and sustainable plan to combat river erosion, turning down any empty promises by the electoral candidates. Although commitments were made several times by the candidates during the past elections to

item.title: Trump says Iran negotiating with US
item.description: US President Donald Trump said on Saturday that Iran is negotiating with the United States. "The plan is that (Iran is) in talks with us, and we'll see whether anything can be achieved. Otherwise, we'll see what happens," Trump told a Fox News correspondent. He said, "the last time they negotiate

item.title: Tourist travel to Saint Martin closed for 9 months from today
item.description: Tourist travel to Saint Martin's Island, the country's only coral island in the Bay of Bengal, has been closed for nine consecutive months from February 1 following the end of the tourism season on January 31. Although the government allowed tourists to visit the island for three months from Novem

item.title: Jailed murder suspect flees using identity of another inmate in Bramanbaria
item.description: A suspect in a murder case has allegedly escaped from Brahmanbaria District Jail using the bail papers of another inmate and committing “identity fraud”. A case has been filed against the absconding suspect and several other inmates, while six prison guards have been temporarily susp

item.title: Posters banned in electioneering, EC tightens rules on banner use
item.description: The Election Commission (EC) has banned posters in electioneering and also imposed stricter controls on banners as part of its Code of Conduct for the 13th National Parliament Election and the Referendum scheduled for February 12. The campaign period, which began on January 22, will end at midnigh

item.title: BNP delegation in meeting with CEC
item.description: A BNP delegation, led by its Central Election Steering Committee Chairman Nazrul Islam Khan, is now in a meeting with Chief Election Commissioner AMM Nasir Uddin ahead of the national election scheduled for February 12 next. The meeting started at around 12:00 pm at Nirbachan Bhaban in the city.

item.title: SC rulings dash election hopes of BNP's Munshi, Gafur as Mobasher stays in the race
item.description: The Supreme Court has rejected appeals by two Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) candidates seeking to contest upcoming parliamentary elections, while allowing another BNP nominee to remain in the race pending a final legal decision. The rulings were delivered on Sunday by a five-member Appellate

item.title: Verdict in Ashulia body burning case on Feb 5
item.description: The International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) has set Feb 5 to deliver its verdict in a crimes against humanity case involving the killing and burning of bodies in Ashulia during the July 2024 mass uprising. The date was fixed on Sunday by a three-member ICT-2 bench headed by Justice Nazrul Islam Chowdh

item.title: India dismisses Epstein claims involving PM Modi as baseless
item.description: The Indian government has rejected claims made in newly released emails from the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, calling them baseless assertions that deserve no credibility. In a statement issued on Saturday, the Ministry of External Affairs said the references in the e

item.title: Three-day Light Engineering Expo to begin in Dhaka on February 2
item.description: A three-day Bangladesh Light Engineering Expo 2026 will begin in the capital on February 2 (Monday), aiming to make the country’s promising light engineering sector more competitive and export-oriented. Organisers said the expo would showcase domestic industrial capacity, reduce import
